notes.text:
An update for Red Hat Data Grid 8 is now available.
 
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Data Grid is an in-memory, distributed, NoSQL datastore solution. It increases application response times and allows for dramatically improving performance while providing availability, reliability, and elastic scale.
 
Data Grid 8.4.7 replaces Data Grid 8.4.6 and includes bug fixes and enhancements. Find out more about Data Grid 8.4.7 in the Release Notes[3].

Security Fix(es):

* TRIAGE CVE-2024-25710 commons-compress: Denial of service caused by an infinite loop for a corrupted DUMP file [jdg-8] (CVE-2024-25710)

* TRIAGE CVE-2024-26308 commons-compress: OutOfMemoryError unpacking broken Pack200 file [jdg-8] (CVE-2024-26308)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: A loop with an unreachable exit condition (Infinite Loop) vulnerability was found in Apache Common Compress. This issue can lead to a denial of service.

Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
No mitigation is currently available for this vulnerability.
